subject: Ethics
title: The Snowden Revelations
description: A quick win: understand The Snowden Revelations.

hook.text: In 2013, a quiet NSA contractor copied thousands of classified files and flew to Hong Kong. The world changed.

buildup.text: Edward Snowden revealed that the NSA was collecting phone records of millions of Americans with no suspicion.

discovery.text: Program PRISM gave the NSA direct access to servers of Google, Apple, and Facebook. Mass surveillance was real.

twist.text: The US government said it was all legal under the Patriot Act. Courts had approved it â€” in secret.

climax.text: Snowden sparked global reform: the USA Freedom Act, EU data rules, and encrypted messaging going mainstream.

punchline.text: One whistleblower showed the world its own reflection.

quiz.question: What did Edward Snowden's leaks primarily reveal?
options: Mass government surveillance of ordinary citizens
